Description: Limestone figure of a bound prisoner of the same type as EA 23825. Wears a high headdress with a central ridge. Face flat with slight details of features. Arms at sides extend forwards, but are lashed at the elbows across the back of the body. The binding also holds the doubled-back legs at the feet, which are shown in some detail, as is the pattern of the cord binding.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Found to the east of the "Qasr" annex, beyond Petrie's chamber 29
Curator's comments: W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 73 § 70, pl. xl, 9, see also p. 53 § 51, p. 54 § 53. This is one of a group of about 30 to 40 similar figures, all found together, of which 5 others are London, BM, EA 23825 to 23827, 23829 to 23830). See also Oxford, AM, 1887.2496-2497 (2 items); Boston, MFA, 87.810-814 (= RES.87.121-125; 5 items altogether); Liverpool, 3.2.87.8; Bristol, H 1987, H1132 (?)
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 73 § 70, pl. xl, 9, see also p. 53 § 51, p. 54 § 53)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.44, p.57-58, p.178, pl.20)
